headline: Stock Market Today, Jan. 22: Netflix Drops as Guidance Tempers Strong Q4 Results
summary: Today, Jan. 22, 2026, investors are weighing blockbuster subscriber and revenue growth against cautious guidance and a massive Warner bid.

headline: Warner Bros. dominates Oscars amid Netflix–Paramount bidding war
summary: Paramount Skydance (PSKY) extended the deadline for its bid to buy Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) on Thursday, while this year's Oscar nominations serve as a reminder of the value of the Warner Bros. studio segment. WBD-produced "Sinners" was nominated for 16 Oscars, breaking the record for the most nominations. Additionally, the Warner Bros. studio received 30 Academy Award nominations, compared to Netflix's 18 and Disney's four. Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma joins Market Domination Overtime to break down the details. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: Paramount extends deadline for Warner Bros. offer, which company calls 'inferior scheme' amid Netflix deal
summary: The drama continues as Paramount extended the deadline for its $108 billion offer to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery.

headline: Paramount Extends Deadline on $108.4B Warner Bros. Discovery Bid
summary: PSKY pushes tender offer to Feb. 20, reiterates $30-per-share offer over Netflix's $27.75 asset bid.

headline: Netflix's Sarandos to testify in Senate hearing on Warner deal, Bloomberg News reports
summary: Netflix co-CEO Ted Sarandos plans to testify ​in February at a ‌U.S. Senate committee hearing examining the company's ‌proposed $82.7 billion purchase of the streaming and studio operations of Warner Bros Discovery, Bloomberg News ⁠reported on ‌Thursday, citing people with knowledge of the matter.  Netflix did ‍not immediately respond to a Reuters request for comment.  Warner Bros confirmed ​the scheduled appearance of chief ‌revenue and strategy officer Bruce Campbell at the hearing.

headline: Paramount Extends Deadline on Warner Bros. Offer. It Won’t Be Enough to Woo Investors.
summary: The CBS owner said in a statement that it would extend the deadline for its tender offer but stuck by its $30-a-share bid.

headline: ‘Barbie’ brought in $1.5 billion for Warner Bros. Discovery, but the company still lost money last quarter
summary: Blockbuster hit “Barbie” brought in a record $1.5 billion for Warner Bros. Discovery, but the company still reported a $417 million loss for the quarter that was bigger than Wall Street’s forecasts.

headline: Paramount Extends Warner Bros. Discovery Tender Deadline
summary: Paramount extended the deadline on its tender offer for Warner Bros. Discovery to Feb. 20 and urged shareholders on Thursday to reject the latest offer from rival suitor Netflix.  The extension gives Paramount more time to court Warner shareholders with its $77.9 billion offer for the full company.  Warner said earlier this week that it had struck a new, all-cash deal with Netflix for its studios and HBO Max streaming service, valued at $72 billion.

headline: ETFs in Spotlight as Netflix Shares Slide Despite Beating Q4 Earnings
summary: Netflix shares slide despite a Q4 earnings beat, putting ETFs like FDN in focus for investors seeking diversified exposure.

headline: Wall Street Lunch: Fed's Favorite Inflation Gauge 'Stuck'?
summary: Rates climb after core PCE holds at 2.8% YoY. GE Aerospace slips as analysts warn margin expansion may slow. EU regulators prepare parallel reviews of rival Warner bids.

headline: PARAMOUNT FILES PROXY MATERIALS AND EXTENDS TENDER OFFER
summary: Paramount Skydance Corporation (NASDAQ: PSKY) ("Paramount") today announced it has filed preliminary proxy materials with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission ("SEC") to solicit shareholders of Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. (NASDAQ: WBD) ("WBD") to vote against the amended transaction with Netflix, Inc. (NASDAQ: NFLX) and related proposals at the special meeting of WBD stockholders. headline: Paramount is betting European regulators won't approve WBD-Netflix. Here's how it could play out

headline: Why Europe will be so important to a WBD deal
summary: The future of the Warner Bros. Discovery cable networks, including CNN, TBS, TNT, Discovery and HGTV, and its U.S. sports rights may come down to European regulators.

headline: Netflix Switches To All-Cash Offer For Warner Bros Discovery Amid Board Support
summary: Netflix Inc. (NASDAQ:NFLX) has decided to switch to an all-cash offer for the acquisition of Warner Bros Discovery (NASDAQ:WBD) studio and streaming businesses. This decision was made without increasing the $82.7 billion price, effectively countering rival Paramount’s (NYSE:PSKY) efforts. Netflix’s new all-cash offer for Warner Bros Discovery’s studio and streaming businesses has received unanimous approval from the latter’s board.
